result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C. VAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Recording, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Comply and register with the sex offender registry for the length of probation plus 15 years.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent.  

No possession of a smart phone. 

No use of the internet unless 1) for work or school; 2) be supervised by someone the agent deems appropriate and 3) is approved by the agent.  

Register all current and past internet accounts, user names and passwords with the DOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher C. VAN

records.addlTxt:
State files an Amended Information charging child enticement, contrary to Section 948.07(4) of the Wisconsin Statutes.   Motion granted.   No contest plea to the amended charge.   Convicted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 12-17-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Defendant is ordered to submit DNA sample.   Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.
Plea hearing is reset to 09-21-15 at 3:30 p.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 06-26-15 at 2:00 p.m.
Plea date is set for 07-02-15 at 11:30 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Request for Adjournment;  Order for Adjournment.
Preliminary hearing is reset to 04-20-15 at 9:30 a.m.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Letter from Attorney Skyberg to Clerk of Court office.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Bail Bond.
The Court amends the previous recognizance bail bond condition so as to allow the defendant to have contact with anyone under the age of 18 as long as an adult family member is supervising the contact.
Copy delivered to jail.
Order for Inspection and Copying of Search Warrant and Affidavit.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-24-15 at 10:00 a.m.   
Minutes.
Re:  Possess Child Pornography, on 09-23-14.

Defendant in custody.  
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of sexual exploitation of a child and possess child pornography.   The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-09-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $15,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with any device with the capability to connect to the internet, or anyone under the age of 18 and defendant must check in, in person, with the City of Manitowoc Police Department every Monday and Friday by 4:30 p.m.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.    
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.   
Minutes.
Affidavit to Seal Warrant and Affidavits; Order to Seal Affidavit and Search Warrant.
Application for Search Warrant and Affidavit in Support of Issuance of Search Warrant.
At 1:08 p.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon. (ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT)
Search warrant issued.  RE:  1413 S. 38th Street, Manitowoc, WI. (ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT)
